text:
330ml bottle - shared by Juks - thanks!
Pale, brief sudsy head, looks brewed with sugars more than malts. Scary malt liquor aroma, some sickly berry jam, something a touch vomitty too at the corners. Alcohol not hidden. Light palate, again says adjuncts, pleasant carbonation. Less unclean taste, fermented adjunct base, quite a punch of alcohol, more berries and skins, some tanniny thin bitterness. Finish is decently fatty, shows that some attention has been paid to the hops. Oooof, this is only for the brave. Or the stupid. Im no fanboi, but Im no hater either.

330ml bottle bought from alco store in Reykjavik. Pours clear golden, small sized white head. Aroma is malty, sweet, some yellow fruits like melon, some bad sourness. Taste is boozy, tart, sweet, malty, syrupy, yellow apple. Tannin aftertaste. Quite light body, very boozy, very malty, med carbo. Interesting, different, but still quite rough and undrinkable.

330ml bottle (thanks Juks). Clear golden color. Small size, bubbly white head, stays. Sweet, malty, candy and acetone in aroma. Sour, red currant, sweet, acetone, tannins in taste. Sweet, malty and sourish in aftertaste. Dry tannin like mouthfeel. Doesnt cover alcohol at all. Needs to be served from 2L PET bottle!

330 ml flaske delt på RBHD-samling på Fjøløy. Klar gyllen kropp med lys film. Malt og noe løsemiddel i aromaen. Vokser litt i munnen og er syrlig og gjæret; får inntrykk av at det fremdeles er gang i denne. Alkovarme tilstede. Ikke noe god.

Shared bottle at RB/HD at Fjøløy 03.09.16. Clear golden. Small white head. Slightly fruity aroma of strong lager beer. Similar taste. More like Elephant-beer strong than barley wine. Probably good for getting drunk.

Pours clear golden, no head. Aroma of strong malty beer. Taste is sweet, corn and alcohol. Nah
Shared bottle at local tasting, fj ØL øy, saturday 2.session..

Shared 330 ml bottle at local tasting. Golden colour, white head. Aroma much like Carlsberg Elephant beer, some sweetish malts, alcohol, a little hops. The flavour is sweet, but not quite as cloying as I feared (pretty close though), very alcoholic.
Golden beer, small head. Aroma is yeast, fruit. Taste is the same, some boozyness at the end. okish
Bottle from a Vínbúdin in Reykjavik. Pours golden with a frothy white head. Light grain aroma. The taste is syrupy grain and booze. Some light spice. Fairly bad.
Quite itneresting was. It is very storng and not so thin but quite dark golden. Very enjoyable in the pier.

Bronze, clear with white foam that dosnt last. Strong aroma of malt mixed with skunk and metal. The skunk wears off quickly. Sweet, alcohol, caramel with alcohol and fruit in the aftertaste. High in carbon.
Bottle. Deep golden color, almost no foam. Aroma: malty, yellow plum wine, esters and alcohols, sweetness. Taste: sweet, very malty, white port, plum, raisin, light hop and alcohol bitterness.

Bottle, DØE Julefrokost @ Aarhus Bryghus. Pours dark yellow with an offwhite head. Aroma of malt, grain, sweetness. grass. Flavor is sweet, malt, grain, sugar, little grass. Medium body, lively carboantion. 161215

bottle @ faroe islands w friends/boilermaker. Appearance: pours slightly hazy golden with ok off-white soapy head and lacing. aroma/taste: barley, alcohol, light caramel and fruity hints. palette medium malty and yeasty 
 aroma, average carbonation, medium body, average to strong sweetness, somewhat balanced by a low to average bitterness, medium duration and an oily texture. Overall: not to exiting - dominated by alcohol and light fruity yeast notes
Eddig nem tudtam mi az a malátalikőr, de ez annak csodálatos. Szinte harapni lehet az alkoholba rejtett malátát. Mint egy viszki.

Bottle. Pours clear darkish golden with airy but stable off-white head. Clear aroma of alcohol and malt, with touches of hops. Sweetish taste of malt, yeast and sugar, ineptly hiding the repulsive alcohol bitterness. Bittersweet, rather incongruous finish. Long live the poor winos pleasure! Id rather have something else.
Deep gold with giant bubbles. Sweet, pretty clean and malty, only a little bit of alcohol...less alcohol taste than Slupp. Not bad for the style, actually.

Its golden with a small head. The aroma has notes of herbs, alcohol and malt. The flavor is sweet but also light in body. The notes are herbs, malt and alcohol, too much for my liking, and the finish is alcohol spicy.

Bottle 330ml. @ home.Clear medium orange - amber yellow colour with a average, quick and frothy, good - fair lacing, mostly to fully diminishing, off-white to white head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty, marzipan malt, sugary malt, light alcohol and caramel malt. Flavour is moderate to light heavy sweet and light to light moderate bitter with a long duration, fruity malt, sugary malt, marzipan malt, buzzy. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft, finish feel is light alcoholic. [20131103]
33cl bottle on the ferry from Seyðisfjørður. Virtually odourless, almost cidery initially, becoming warmer and beerier towards the end. Much undermalted for its strength.
DØE:sweet malty aroma,amber, clear, off white foam, light sweetness, lightly bitter, light body, creamy, soft carbonation, nice special finish.
@CPH BF 2013. Amber coloured and a bit hazy. Has a white head, medium duration. Malty and herbal aroma. Flavor starts heavy sweet, more malty notes, finish light bitter.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ BF 2013. Golden colour with a mediumsized head. Aroma is mild fruits some sweet malts, alcohol as well as toffee and some gluelike stinging notes. Flavour is sweet malts, alcohol, some herbs, grass and overall rather sweet. Could do with a bit less alcohol to be more balanced and pleasant...
bottle. dep golden colour with an off-white head. Aroma is alcohol, malt, fruit. Flavour is  sweet, alcohol, malt, fruit, apple, hop. Full body. Ordinary beer.
Bottle from Salling. Clear golden with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, fruity and alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet and light bitter. Sweet finish with lots of alcohol. Boozy. 140313
Bottle from Salling. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are malt, fruits, grass and hops.

UPDATED: JUN 8, 2013 Bottle . Pours clear golden with an off-white head. Aroma of fruitiness, malt, alcohol, marzipan and caramel. Flavor is sweet and  malty with some warming alcohol, yellow apples, some vinous notes and some herbal notes. Medium to full body, average carbonation.

Bottle. Its a clear one, golden in color and topped by a small, dense, off-white head. The aroma has some alcohol sweetness, as well as generic fruityness, yellow apples and some maltyness. The flavor has quite a lot of alcohol, but not as pushing and disturbing as found in some strong European lagers. Enough bitterness, especially in the end, to deal with the sweetness, still its not a very balanced beer, as the alcohol plays a too dominant role. Full body, warming and pleasantly carbonated. Lasting finish. Not a beer to drink on its own, but far from undrinkable. 130119

Bottle 330ml @ Geokkjer
Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma has notes of malt, caramel, alcohol and some fruity yeast. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Body is medium to full, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Creamy white good mostly deminishing head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and light hoppy aroma. Light bitter flavor. Average moderate bitter finish. Oily palate.

Tiny ugly lace at a golden clear beer. Looks like a cheap lager. Dry, oats, rough. Not worth the alcohol at all. Boozy ending. Not good, but a great country tick thanks to my upstairs neighbour. (Bottle at Deansos tasting)
Bottle at a Den Haag RB tasting. A reddish straw coloured pour. A yeasty malty lager-like aroma. The flavour is a yeasty warm and malty. A decent effort from a small island.
Bottle. Clear golden color, no head. Very alcoholic, sweety aroma. Flavor is very alcoholic, sweet and has a watery palate. More of an imperial pils to me.
Bottle @ tasting. Aroma is metallic vegetable, some spicy malt. Flavour is malty bready, slight metal. Meh.

33cl bottle thanks to EricKok.
Thin white head.  Clear golden pour.  Ok.  Thin taste.

Medium beige head.  Clear coppery body with carbonation.  Sugary
artificial candy aroma with caramelly notes.  Sweet-dryish
artificial sugary caramelly taste with smoky notes.  Mid-to-full
body.  Faintly sharp mouthfeel.  Dryish fruity candy aftertaste
with smoky spicy notes.  Did not enjoy.  (0.33l bottle, Fish &
Beer, Copenhagen.)
Bottle. Pours golden with a small white head. Strange chemical aroma with notes of smoke and butter. Heavy marzipan notes in taste. Also vegtables. Warming. Semi smooth. Alcoholic.

Bottle.
Pours flat amber without any head.
Warming aroma of apples and pear, bit xmasy without the spices.
Taste of marzipan and alcohol, like a bad bock

Draught at Café Natúr, Tórshavn. 

Fruity, fatly malty and quite balanced.

Heldur sött. Djúpur gull-gulur litur, lítið hövd. Sött anga við malti og karamel afturvið okkurt av alkoholi. Hampulig munnfyllu. Hon smakkar heldur sött eisini, maltað við karamel og alkohol. Hampulig beiskleika. Sött bjór.
Lagery aroma. Spicy aniseed aroma. Clear golden colour. Small white head. The flavour is sweet with a little aniseed and a mild yeasty note.
33 cl bottle. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is toasted malty and light caramelish. Bitter and toasted malty. Bitter and dry hoppy finish. Toastd malty. Dry.

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a clear amber with no head. Sweet, malty and lightly fruity with quite some booze up front. Rich malty body, low carbonation. Sweet and sugary fruit, no real bitterness, but quite some booze. 110512
